place.name: INGHAM
place.gazetteerText: INGHAM, a parish in Thingoe district, Suffolk; 4 miles N of Bury-St. Edmunds r. station. It has a postoffice under Bury-St. Edmunds. Acres, 1,808. Real property, £1, 721. Pop., 236. Houses, 45. The manor belongs to the Rev. E. R. Benyon. The living is a rectory, united with the rectories of Culford and Timworth, in the diocese of Ely. Value, £549.* Patron, the Rev. E. R. Benyon. Charities, £8. (In 1870-72, John Marius Wilson's Imperial Gazetteer of England and Wales)
